name: 3-DTR to Feeder Mapping Methodologies
content:
DTR to Feeder Mapping Methodologies


For mapping DTRs to Feeders, we applied a combination of temporal event alignment, power trend correlation, and zero consumption pattern matching to ensure accuracy even in low-load or outage-heavy scenarios.


‚úÖ A. Zero Consumption Matching

  • Objective: Capture time windows (hourly) when both DTR and Feeder showed zero power consumption, indicating a shared outage or shutdown event.
  • Method:
  • Identify zero-energy intervals in Feeder and DTR data.
  • Align by timestamp at hourly granularity.
  • Score Feeder-DTR pairs by the number of matching zero consumption windows.
  • Purpose: Especially useful in regions with frequent outages or load shedding, and complements correlation-based methods where load variation is low.


‚úÖ B. Power Event Matching (Hourly)

  • Objective: Detect OFF/ON power transition events and align between DTR and Feeder.
  • Method:
  • Extract power-down or power-up timestamps from both Feeder and DTR time series.
  • Normalize events at hourly resolution.
  • Compute overlap percentage and assign matching scores.


‚úÖ C. Power Consumption Trend Correlation

  • Objective: Establish connection through weekly or daily energy usage trends.
  • Method:
  • Aggregate energy data weekly for each DTR and Feeder.
  • Calculate change in energy (ŒîkWh) or moving averages.
  • Apply Pearson or Spearman correlation to detect similarity.
  • Score based on correlation coefficient.


üîç Final Mapping Output

  • DTRs linked to Feeders with:
  • Event Match Score
  • Zero Consumption Match Score
  • Power Correlation Score
  • Highest ranked Feeder per DTR tagged as Primary Feeder.
  • Alternative close matches marked as Secondary Candidates for validation.
